function.description: This construct combines a template and a model using the given engine and writes the result to the provided output.

parameterDescriptions.parameterDescription: The name and extension of the template file. This file must be located in the `templatesDirectory` of the (given) engine.
The stream which the template engine will be written to. When willing to write to a file, use the `File` plugin.
The data necessary to process the given template. When not providing this parameter (or giving an empty object) this would result in processing the template without any data.

The engine to be for processing the templates. This engine is the value returned from the `getEngine`-construct. When this parameter is omitted the Template plugin will either use the engine created by a previous Template.getEngine() construct or create a new default engine if there is no engine created yet.

function.longDescription: This plugin uses a third-party library named FreeMarker to process the templates. For more information please check their [website](http://freemarker.org/docs/index.html).

example.title: Default Usage
example.header: The template named template.txt is located at the project's root directory. The template gets combined with the provided model. The result of the template-processing is written to the outputFolder located at the project's root directory. The default engine is created by the Template plugin.

example.header: In this example no model is used and the template.txt will be parsed as is. However if model variables are used in the template, the process will terminate with an error.
